ticket.title: 'rails server' command ignores BUNDLE_GEMFILE
ticket.original-body: When running rails new APP_NAME the config/boot.rb that is generated in Rails 3 ignores and overrides the BUNDLE_GEMFILE environment variable with the default of 'Gemfile'. see: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/app/templates/config/boot.rb You can workaround this with no code changes by using bundle exec rails server Or just change config/boot.rb line 4 from @@@ ruby gemfile = File.expand_path('../../Gemfile', __FILE__) @@@ to something like @@@ ruby gemfile = File.expand_path('../../' + (ENV['BUNDLE_GEMFILE'] || 'Gemfile'), __FILE__) @@@
ticket.latest-body: When running rails new APP_NAME the config/boot.rb that is generated in Rails 3 ignores and overrides the BUNDLE_GEMFILE environment variable with the default of 'Gemfile'. see: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/app/templates/config/boot.rb You can workaround this with no code changes by using bundle exec rails server Or just change config/boot.rb line 4 from @@@ ruby gemfile = File.expand_path('../../Gemfile', __FILE__) @@@ to something like @@@ ruby gemfile = File.expand_path('../../' + (ENV['BUNDLE_GEMFILE'] || 'Gemfile'), __FILE__) @@@
ticket.original-body-html:
When running
rails new APP_NAME
the config/boot.rb that is generated in Rails 3 ignores and overrides the BUNDLE_GEMFILE environment variable with the default of 'Gemfile'.
see:
https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/railties/lib/rails/gener...

You can workaround this with no code changes by using
bundle exec rails server

Or just change config/boot.rb line 4 from

gemfile = File.expand_path('../../Gemfile', FILE)
to something like
gemfile = File.expand_path('../../' + (ENV['BUNDLE_GEMFILE'] || 'Gemfile'), FILE)

version.body: When running rails new APP_NAME the config/boot.rb that is generated in Rails 3 ignores and overrides the BUNDLE_GEMFILE environment variable with the default of 'Gemfile'. see: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/app/templates/config/boot.rb You can workaround this with no code changes by using bundle exec rails server Or just change config/boot.rb line 4 from @@@ ruby gemfile = File.expand_path('../../Gemfile', __FILE__) @@@ to something like @@@ ruby gemfile = File.expand_path('../../' + (ENV['BUNDLE_GEMFILE'] || 'Gemfile'), __FILE__) @@@
version.body-html:
When running
rails new APP_NAME
the config/boot.rb that is generated in Rails 3 ignores and overrides the BUNDLE_GEMFILE environment variable with the default of 'Gemfile'.
see:
https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/railties/lib/rails/gener...

You can workaround this with no code changes by using
bundle exec rails server

Or just change config/boot.rb line 4 from

gemfile = File.expand_path('../../Gemfile', FILE)
to something like
gemfile = File.expand_path('../../' + (ENV['BUNDLE_GEMFILE'] || 'Gemfile'), FILE)
version.title: 'rails server' command ignores BUNDLE_GEMFILE

version.body:
The fixes applied won't work if someone deletes Gemfile and sets `BUNDLE_GEMFILE` to one that does exist since it checks if `gemfile` exists and not `ENV['BUNDLE_GEMFILE']`. This is fixed in the master branch but not 3-0-stable branch.
Attached is a backport of master changes to fix this problem.
version.body-html:
The fixes applied won't work if someone deletes Gemfile and sets BUNDLE_GEMFILE to one that does exist since it checks if gemfile exists and not ENV['BUNDLE_GEMFILE']. This is fixed in the master branch but not 3-0-stable branch.

Attached is a backport of master changes to fix this problem.
version.title: 'rails server' command ignores BUNDLE_GEMFILE

version.body:
Samuel: I've already rebuilt the boot.rb file to use "require 'bundler/setup'", this is the preferred way to do that: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/0646c706e69eddc7e1ee213c65952967128aa545
Sorry for confusion.
version.body-html:
Samuel: I've already rebuilt the boot.rb file to use "require 'bundler/setup'", this is the preferred way to do that: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/0646c706e69eddc7e1ee213c65952...

Sorry for confusion.
version.title: 'rails server' command ignores BUNDLE_GEMFILE
